org.apache.river.qa.harness

Class AbstractServiceAdmin

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.river.qa.harness.AbstractServiceAdmin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Admin
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActivatableServiceStarterAdmin, ActivationSystemAdmin, ClassServerAdmin, NonActivatableGroupAdmin, NonActivatableServiceStarterAdmin, RunningServiceAdmin, SharedGroupAdmin

    public abstract class AbstractServiceAdmin
extends Object
implements Admin
    An abstract class supporting admins which use strings to identify services (serviceName), and index to specify an instance count for a given service, and a collection of well known tokens which are appended to the serviceName to create property names used to search the test properties for service configuration values.

    This class provides two sets of accessors. The first set consists of a collection of protected methods with names of the form getServiceFoo, where Foo is a service parameter such as codebase or classpath. Subclasses should call these methods when generating the service descriptors or command lines needed to run the service. There are also a parallel set of public method with names of the form getFoo, which return the cached values of results previously returned by their getServiceFoo counterparts. The latter set of methods are intended for debug output, and to allow tests to obtain the parameters actually used to start services. This class provides accessors for the following well-known tokens:

    type the service type
    impl the back-end implementation class name of the service
    codebase the codebase for the service
    component the component name used to reference entries in the services Configuration
    host the host the service should run on when running in distributed mode. May be an explicit host name or one of 'master', 'slave', or 'slaveN' where N is an integer. If an explicit host is specified, that host name must be present in the system property org.apache.river.qa.harness.testhosts.
    classpath the classpath for the service
    policyfile the security policy file for the service
    serverjvm the path for the jvm to execute for the service
    serverjvmargs options and properties for the service vm
    activationhost the host running the activation system
    activationport the port for contacting the activation system
    serviceConfigurationthe configuration file for the service
    starterConfigurationthe configuration file for the service starter
    preparername the fully qualified name of the entry for the ProxyPreparer for the service proxy in the test ConfigurationFile
    dir a directory specifier (only used by class server)
    port a port number (only used by reggie)
    tojoin the set of groups and locators a service should join
    membergroups the set of groups a lookup service should advertise
    log a token incorporated into the name of a services persistence log
    integrityhash if true, the service codebase is to be converted to an httpmd URL. This property is not generally defined, allowing the global org.apache.river.qa.harness.integrityHhash property to control this behavior.
    autoDestroy if defined and false, inhibit the automatic termination of the service in the test teardown method. Rarely used to eliminate spurious stack traces in tests which use the service's DestroyAdmin directly.

    The logger named org.apache.river.qa.harness.service is used to log debug information

    Level Description
    FINE parameter values used to start the service

        protected final String getServiceCodebase()
                                   throws TestException

      • getServiceOptions

        protected String[] getServiceOptions()
        Return any command line options to be included when starting the service. The options returned are the union of the following sources:
        • the options returned by calling config.getGlobalVMArgs()
        • the options parsed from the string obtained from the environment as a result of searching for the key serviceName + ".serverjvmargs"
        Returns:
        a String array of command line options, or null if none were found

      • getOptions

        public String[] getOptions()
        Return the command line options originally returned by the getServiceOptions method.
        Returns:
        the service options

      • getServiceProperties

        protected String[] getServiceProperties()
                                 throws TestException
        Return any command line properties to be included when starting the service. The returned array contains alternating property-name/property-value pairs. The '-D', '-OD' and '=' strings are not present. As a result, the array must contain an even number of elements. The properties returned are the union of the following sources:
        • the properties contained in the array returned by calling config.getGlobalVMArgs()
        • the properties parsed from the string obtained from the environment as a result of searching for the key serviceName + ".serverjvmprops"
        The harness treats the definition '-ODname=value' specially. This represents a property to be defined only if a value is provided. Thus, any property resolved as '-ODname=' will be discarded. This is intended to propogate a property from the parent to the child VM only if that property is defined in the parent VM.
        Returns:
        a String array of command line options, or null if none were found
        Throws:
        TestException - if the returned array would contain an odd number of elements

      • getProperties

        public String[] getProperties()
        Return the command line properties originally returned by the getServiceProperties method. This method is provided primarily providing information to logging methods. If the getServiceProperties is overridden, then this method should be overridden as well.
        Returns:
        the service properties

      • getServiceConfigurationFileName

        protected String getServiceConfigurationFileName()
                                          throws TestException
        Return the name of the ConfigurationFile for the service. If the current configuration tag is 'none', then the value "-" is returned. Otherwise, the test properties are searched for a value for serviceName + ".serviceConfiguration". If the value is "-", that value is returned. Otherwise the value is converted to an absolute path name relative to the current configuration root directory.
        Returns:
        the service configuration file name
        Throws:
        TestException - if the configuration file is undefined

      • addServiceConfigurationFileName

        protected void addServiceConfigurationFileName(List list)
                                        throws TestException
        Add the name of the service configuration file to the given list. The test properties must contain a value for serviceName + ".serviceConfiguration". The value obtained from the test properties is converted to an absolute path name relative to the current configuration root directory.
        Parameters:
        list - the list to append the configuration file name
        Throws:
        TestException - if the configuration file is not defined

      • getConfigurationFileName

        public String getConfigurationFileName()
        Return the configuration file name originally obtained by the getServiceConfigurationFileName method.
        Returns:
        the service configuration file name

      • getServiceConfiguration

        protected net.jini.config.Configuration getServiceConfiguration()
                                                         throws TestException
        Obtain the Configuration object associated with the service configuration file. If the 'none' configuration was selected, then EmptyConfiguration.INSTANCE is returned. Otherwise, the test properties must contain a value for serviceName + ".serviceConfiguration". The value obtained from the test properties is converted to an absolute path name relative to the current configuration root directory. A Configuration instance is generated from the file.
        Returns:
        the configuration object for the service
        Throws:
        TestException - if generation of the configuration object fails or the configuration file is undefined

      • getServiceStarterConfigurationFileName

        protected String getServiceStarterConfigurationFileName()
                                                 throws TestException
        Return the name of the ConfigurationFile for the service's starter. If the 'none' configuration is selected, return '-'. Otherwise, the test properties must contain a value for serviceName + ".starterConfiguration". If the value is "-", that value is returned. Otherwise the value obtained from the test properties is converted to an absolute path name relative to the current configuration root directory.
        Returns:
        the service configuration file name
        Throws:
        TestException - if the starter configuration is undefined

      • getStarterConfigurationFileName

        public String getStarterConfigurationFileName()
        Return the configuration file name originally obtained by the getServiceStarterConfigurationFileName method.
        Returns:
        the service's starter configuration file name

      • getStarterConfiguration

        protected net.jini.config.Configuration getStarterConfiguration()
                                                         throws TestException
        Obtain the Configuration object associated with the service's starter configuration file. If the 'none' configuration is selected, EmptyConfiguration.INSTANCE is returned. Otherwise, the test properties must contain a value for serviceName + ".starterConfiguration". The value obtained from the test properties is converted to an absolute path name relative to the current configuration root directory. A Configuration instance is generated from the file.
        Returns:
        the configuration object for the service's starter
        Throws:
        TestException - if generation of the configuration object fails or the start configuration file is undefined

      • fixCodebase

        protected String fixCodebase(String codebase)
                      throws TestException
        Convert an http codebase to an httpmd codebase if the service requires codebase integrity. The test properties are searched for the key serviceName + ".integrityhash". On failure, a search is performed for the key "org.apache.river.qa.harness.integrityhash". If either search is successful and the corresponding value is not "none", then codebase integrity is assumed and the property value is interpreted as the secure hash algorithm to use. The given codebase may contain multiple URLs separated by white space.
        Parameters:
        codebase - the codebase to fix, which may be null
        Returns:
        the possibly modified codebase
        Throws:
        TestException - if codebase integrity is required and the codebase URL is malformed or is not an http URL

      • getMandatoryParameter

        protected String getMandatoryParameter(String property)
                                throws TestException
        Convenience method to return the value of a key which must exist in the test properties.
        Parameters:
        property - the service property to search for (without the leading '.')
        Returns:
        the corresponding test properties value
        Throws:
        TestException - if the value is not found

      • logServiceParameters

        protected void logServiceParameters()
                             throws TestException
        Generate logging output displaying the parameters which were provided by the accessors of this class. If a subclass provides additional accessor methods, that class should provide an override of this method, first calling super.logServiceParameters and then log records for the accessor values added by the subclass should be written. The source information is set to null in the log records to improve the readability of the output. In most cases, output for a parameter is generated only if that parameter was initialized through its getServiceXXX accessor.
        Throws:
        TestException - if the type property is undefined.

      • logOverrides

        protected void logOverrides(String[] overrides)
        Log the option arguments passed to the service.
        Parameters:
        overrides - the set of overrides to log

      • addServiceUnicastDiscoveryPort

        protected void addServiceUnicastDiscoveryPort(ArrayList list)
                                       throws TestException
        Add configuration override values to list specifying initial unicast discovery port.
        Parameters:
        list - the command-line list
        Throws:
        TestException - if the component name is undefined for this service

      • addServiceGroupsAndLocators

        protected void addServiceGroupsAndLocators(ArrayList list)
                                    throws TestException
        Add configuration override values to list specifying the initial groups and initial locators the service is to use. The tojoin service property is retrieved and overrides are generated for the well-known entry names initialLookupGroups and initialLookupLocators. The values are formatted such that the entries returned from the configuration file will be arrays of LookupLocators or arrays of Strings, as appropriate. Group names are made unique. If the 'none' configuration was selected, the locators created are LookupLocators; otherwise, the locators created are ConstrainableLookupLocators.
        Parameters:
        list - the overrides list
        Throws:
        TestException

      • getGroups

        public String[] getGroups()
        Return the set of groups originally generated by a previous call to addServiceGroupsAndLocators.
        Returns:
        the array of groups

      • getLocators

        public net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator[] getLocators()
        Return the set of locators originally generated by a previous call to addServiceGroupsAndLocators.
        Returns:
        the array of locators

      • addServiceMemberGroups

        protected void addServiceMemberGroups(ArrayList list)
                               throws TestException
        Add configuration override values to list specifying the member groups the service is to use. The membergroups service property is retrieved and overrides are generated for the well-known entry name initialMemberGroups. The values are formatted such that the entries returned from the configuration file will be arrays of Strings. The groups are randomized.
        Parameters:
        list - the options list to append the overrides to
        Throws:
        TestException

      • getMemberGroups

        public String[] getMemberGroups()
        Return the set of member groups originally generated by a previous call to addServiceMemberGroups.
        Returns:
        the set of membergroups

      • addServicePersistenceLog

        protected void addServicePersistenceLog(ArrayList list)
                                 throws TestException
        Add a configuration override for the persistence log. The log service property value is retrieved and is used to generate a unique directory name. The value is formatted as a string literal containing the fully qualified name of the log directory assigned to the configuration value named persistenceDirectory. If the value of log is "none", then no persistence log override is added to the list. If the value of log is provided as an absolute path name, then that value is used directly
        Parameters:
        list - options list to append to
        Throws:
        TestException - if the directory cannot be created, or if the log name was absolute and the named directory exists

      • getServicePersistenceLog

        protected String getServicePersistenceLog()
                                   throws TestException
        Get the name of the service persistence log. The log service property value is retrieved and is used to generate a unique directory name. If the value of log is "none", then this method returns null. If the value of log is provided as an absolute path name, then that value is returned. The expected usage is that the property value will be a simple token used to generate the name of a persistence directory in the temp file system. If the property is undefined, a default value of 'log' is used.
        Returns:
        the log directory expressed as an absolute path name
        Throws:
        TestException - if the directory cannot be created, or if the log name was absolute and the named directory exists

      • addServiceExporter

        protected void addServiceExporter(ArrayList list)
                           throws TestException
        Add the service exporter override to the given list. The exporter name is retrieved from the configuration by getting the entry named "exporter.name". The value of this entry should be the name which the service uses to obtain it's exporter. The exporter is defined as one of "exporter.activatableExporter", "exporter.persistentExporter", or "exporter.transientExporter", as determined by the type parameter for this service. The configuration is presumed to contain actual exporter entries which map to these names. If there is no entry named "exporter.name", or if the 'none' configuration is selected, this method logs that fact and returns without modifying the list. This may be appropriate for remote test objects with hard-coded exports.
        Parameters:
        list - the override list into which to place the override
        Throws:
        TestException - if the configuration is undefined

      • getLogDir

        public String getLogDir()
        Return the persistence log directory name originally generated by a previous call to addServicePersistenceLog.
        Returns:
        the log name

      • addRegisteredOverrides

        protected void addRegisteredOverrides(List list)
                               throws TestException
        Add any test defined overrides to the argument list. The set of registered OverrideProviders is retrieved from the test properties and all overrides returned by the provider are appended to the list. Any returned override with an entry name identical to one already present in the list will replace that entry. Therefore, this method should be the final method called when setting up the overrides.
        Parameters:
        list - the options argument list
        Throws:
        TestException - if an error occurs in the call to a providers getOverrides method.

      • doProxyPreparation

        protected Object doProxyPreparation(Object proxy)
                             throws TestException
        Prepare the service proxy. The name of the preparer must have been obtained by an earlier call to getServicePreparerName. If the preparer name is non-null, a proxy preparer having that name must be present in the test configuration; that preparer is used to prepare the given service proxy, and the prepared proxy is returned. If the preparer name is null, the original proxy is returned. If the configuration is undefined (as result of the "none" config tag), the original object is returned.
        Parameters:
        proxy - the proxy to prepare
        Throws:
        TestException - if preparation fails, or if the earlier call to getServicePreparerName found a preparer name, but no entry having that name could be found in the test configuration

      • registerDescriptorTransformer

        public void registerDescriptorTransformer(ServiceDescriptorTransformer t)
        Register a ServiceDescriptorTransformer to be called immediately before the create method is called. this method must be called before the start method is called.
        Parameters:
        t - the transformer

      • doRandom

        protected boolean doRandom()
        Determine whether randomization of groups is to be done. Some admins (RunningServiceAdmin) require non-randomized groups.
        Returns:
        true if groups are to be randomized

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Return the service name.
        Returns:
        the name

      • getTransformer

        protected ServiceDescriptorTransformer getTransformer()
        Returns:
        the transformer
